About: This repository contains data pertaining to Crime in Troy, NY between 2013 and 2018

ID.Description: Artificially generated by the data processing script (created for this assignment); unique ID for each crime record

Incident_ID.Description: ID assigned by Troy Police Department for each crime record

Location.Description: Where the crime occurred; i.e. school, residential, hospital, etc.

Date_Time.Description: Time of crime in human readable format; i.e. 'Mar 28, 2013 3:33 PM'

Agency.Description: Agency that submitted crime to database

Address.Description: Address of where crime occurred; parts of each address have been ommitted for privacy purposes

Date_Time_Unix.Description: Time of crime (minutes and seconds ommitted) in UNIX format

Condition.Description: I.e. Clouds, clear, rain, mist, fog

Rain_3h.Description: Rain volume last 3 hours in millimeters

Snow_3h.Description: Snow volume last 3 hours in millimeters

Additional_Information.Note_1: Everytime new crime/weather records are added to the CSV data file, the time in which these records were added and their respective ID range (lowest and highest ID) will be added to the 'Data_Generation_Metadata' section of this metadata document. The time in which the records were added to the CSV file will be written in the following format: in YYYY:MM:DD:HH:MM:{AM|PM}.
Additional_Information.Note_2: The link to the LexisNexis Community Crime Map service where Troy, NY crime data was scraped is: http://communitycrimemap.com/?address
Additional_Information.Note_3: The link to the weather data source is: https://openweathermap.org/price ($10 to get historical bulk weather info for a particular city)
Additional_Information.Note_4: Additional metadata can be found here: https://openweathermap.org/history-bulk#list
Additional_Information.Note_5: The data contains crimes reported between January 1, 2013 and December 31, 2018
Additional_Information.Note_6: Dates and locations of each prime can be considered provenance, as they allow any crime record to be verified for its authenticity; the same is true for the weather data

Crime.Crime Record Dates: The date/time in which each crime took place is recorded; can be verified
Crime.Crime Record Locations: The location at which each crime took place is recorded; can be verified

Weather.Weather Data Sources: NOAA GFS model, Environment Canada, European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts, Japan Meteorological Agency in addition to 40,000 owned and operated weather stations;
Weather.Weather Record Dates: The date for which each condition/temperature is recorded can be verified
